name: 曾祥森
objective:
CALCULUS(I)     OUTLINES
This course aims at developing comprehension of derivation and integral、activating capabilities of logic inference and induction、enlightening confidence and independence、strengthening calculating abilities with an emphasis on its application and diagram、furnishing a sound basis for future specialty. 
The content of  Calculus(I) includes: 1. Functions and Limits, 2.Derivatives, 3. Inverse Functions (includes Transcendental Functions), 4. Applications of Differentiation, 5. Integrals, 6.Techniques of Integration.
schedule:
SYLLABUS
Week 1 ---Functions, The limit of a function, Calculating limits
Week 2 ---Continuity, Limits involving infinity
Week 3 ---Derivatives and rates of change, The derivative as a function, Basic differentiation formulas, The product and quotient rules
Week 4 ---The chain rule, Implicit differentiation, Related rates,
Linear approximations and differentials    ( First Test)
Week 5 ---Exponential functions, Inverse functions and Logarithms
Week 6 ---Derivatives of Logarithmic and Exponential functions,
Exponential Growth and Decay
Week 7 ---Hyperbolic functions, Indeterminate forms and L’Hospital’s rule
Week 8 ---Review for midterm exam
Week 9 ---Midterm exam
Week 10 –Maximum and minimum values, The mean value theorem
Week 11 –Derivatives and the shapes of graphs, Curve sketching
Week 12 –Optimization problems, Newton’s method, Antiderivatives
Week 13 –Areas and distances, The definite integral, Evaluating definite integrals
Week 14 –The fundamental theorem of calculus, The substitution rule  (Second Test)
Week 15 –Integration by parts, Trigonometric integrals and substitutions, Partial fractions
Week 16 –Integration with tables, Approximate integration, Improper integrals
Week 17 –Review for final exam
Week 18 –Final exam
scorePolicy:
GRADE
1. Homeworks 20%
2. Tests(2) 30%
3. Midterm exam 20%
4. Final exam 30%
